borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The scale and siting of the proposed outbuilding is considered harmful to the character of the area and plot, closing off open and spacious gardens to the rear of the property, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. Furthermore, the scale and layout of the outbuilding, combined with the side access route from the highway, it cannot be confirmed the outbuilding would have an ancillary function to the main dwellinghouse. As such, the proposed development is contrary to: </p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);</p><p>- Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021);</p><p>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); and</p><p>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

The proposed development, by reason of the scale, siting and design, would result in an unacceptable loss of privacy to 116 Wood Lane, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);

- Policies D4 & D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);

- Policies BP8 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);

- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); and

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).
description: Construction of an outbuilding for a use incidental to the enjoyment of the dwellinghouse
